page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO HOUSTON
page.content: {HOUSTON}is an expanding village, situated in the West of Scotland, 30km from the city of{Glasgow.}It is a lowland rural area and the river {Gryffe,}a tributary of the Clyde,flows through it.It is essentially an agricultural area,but in recent years the village has expanded,replacing farmland with residential development. Today, many of the inhabitants are employed in service industries and work outwith Houston. Settlement in this area goes back to { Neolithic times and ancient burial grounds can still be seen at North Mound and South Mound. Houston itself only began to develop as a significant settlement towards the end of the 18th century. The village was given to Sir Hugh de Padvinan in the 12th century and became known as{"Hugh's Town", then Houston.
